text: Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! Pours very light yellow water colour. Aroma of sweet and strong melon, hints of alcohol. Taste of medium sweet heavy melon, a bit dry, thick body, the alcohol is present.

Bottle from a local Asian supermarket. 14.5%. Sweetish mild melon nose. Neutral mild beginning. Hints of fruity melon. Smooth and quite neutral, fresh, not too deep but nice in the body with a mellow fragile aroma. Smooth and slightly sweetish aftertaste. Crisp and mild with hints of melon, but not too deep or aromaful. Easy to drink with hints of alcohol. ok.

Bottle
Aroma-rice, alcohol, 
Appearance-pale, clear, 
Taste-light sweetness, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, no finish
Overall-very dissapinted

Bottle @ Home, courtesy of Henriksoegaard. Pours waterlike with just a small reddish tint. Aroma of rice, light sweetness, and light alcohol. Flavor is rice and alcohol. Medium body, oily mouthfeel, alcoholic finish. 010113

Pierwsze sake w moim życiu. Niespecjalnie przypadło mi do gustu. Głównie za sprawą posmaku i aromatu etanolu. Lekko słodki posmak także nie był dla mnie smaczny. W zapachu wyczuwało się natomiast ryż. Wygląd jasnosłomkowy, mało apetyczny
light sweet friture rice aroma,pale, clear, light sweetness rice alcoholic,light dry,flat, alcoholic.
Almost clear as water, no head. Aroma of sweet rice and frying oil. Flavor is mainly sweet, fermented rice. Syrupy texture.
Bottle courtesy Fonefan. Clear water colour. Not pleasent almond aroma. Moderate dry almond/ marcipan flavor. Average finish. Watery palate. Not pleasent.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear as water without head. Aroma is sweet, rice and a little alcohol. Flavor is very sweet. Very sweet finish withheavy alcohol. Watery. 300312
Ulfborg Scooper Smagning 2012. Clear with no head. Aroma of grain and boiled rice, with fruity, floral notes, some toffee and notable alcohol. Thin, fruity sweet flavour, thin and in-offensive.

Bottle, 75cl courtesy of fonefan. An oily pour leaves a clear, almost non-colored body. Papery rice, some fruityness, almond extract and some sugary notes on the nose. Alcoholic too, and that goes for the flavor as well. And the aftertaste. Oily, warming mouthfeel with rice, fruityness and something sugary. Too unclean and not very pleasant. 110128
Bottle. Clear colour with no head. aroma is rice, alcohol, soya, paper. Flavour is rice, alcohol, paper. Mild sake.
botlle at jans ... clear ... soft dull sharp spirit nose ... odd medicinal spirit ... quite rought ... light floral rice linger

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours crystal clear with a vague yellowish tint. Intense and sweet rice aroma. Medium body, soft mouthfeel and a rather hot and boozy finish. 280111

Bottle 750ml @ fonefan
Clear water color. Aroma has notes of rice, almonds and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet.
Bottle, 15%. Alcohol aroma, some water. Clear water colour. The flavour is alcohol and water. Perhaps a little water chestnut.
Bottle from FOneFan. Clear as water with no head. Flavour is rice, water and alcohol.
Bottle at fonefan tasting. No head. Color is pale as water. Aroma and taste are almonds, marcipan and alcohol.

Bottle 750ml.Clear cristal clear color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, floral. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration, alcohol, rice, ruff. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20101119]
Bottle @ Friday Night Ulfborg Thing. Thanks to J&C. Pours clear no color- no head. Nose is raw and spicy. Sweet alcoholic and burning. Lots of rice . . .I cant drink it!
25 cL bottle, courtesy of fiulijn. Pours pale and with no head. Aroma is rice and slight fruity. Sweet rice flavoured, subdued fruity and mild alcohol presence. Ends dry and rice flavoured.
Bottled. A water colored sake. The aroma has notes of rice. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol and rice, leading to a dry alcoholic finish. Thanks fiulijn.

07/06 Had several shots from 0.75 l bottle courtesy of ogivlado, thanks a lot! This sake had just slightly yellow color body with good oily legs. Quite skunky aroma, bad rice, some wood with industrial notes and alcohol for sure. Flavor was pretty oily and full, but as its sake leaves watery impression. Notes of wood here beats medicinal notes. Short but fine aftertaste. Very easy for drinking, although its clearly seen its of much lower quality than the other sake Ive tried few months ago.
Bottle: Poured a clear color. The aroma was very alcohol and thinner. The taste is watery with a warm medicine and alcohol burn.

0.75l bottle. Produced by Choya Umeshu Deutschland in Willich. I spotted this almost by accident in the big Merkur store near the Graz bus station, and ozujsko got it (thanks!). My second sake, and Im not completely sure I still fully understand the subleties of this type of beverage. Completely clear and still, like water. Nose... interesting. Medicinal, a bit overly so, nice notes of rice crackers and some nougat. The taste is sweeter than the last I had. Watery of course, some weak lemon and some medicine. Not bad, but didnt impress me. Wish I couldve done a side by side comparison with Mitoku. The medicinal "quality" apparently gets a lot more pronounced when warm, but I didnt try it that way, and it wasnt as bad as I expected it to be. I might be underrating it too.
ColdYellow hue. The aroma shows a high presence of phenol. The flavor is as well too much medicinal, with light fruitness and without any other complexity.

Paint thinner and floorboard nose.
Quite clear, doesnt show legs.
Somewhat watery mouthfeel.
Dry mouthfeel. Easy to drink, not much character.
